articleContent.title: Chord: 6th in C (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord Entity: 6th in C (Shape: C)

## Overview
The 6th chord in C major, commonly played in the C position, consists of the notes C, E, G, and A. The 6th chord adds a sweet and melodic flavor to music compositions, creating a sense of warmth and richness. It is commonly used in various genres, including pop, jazz, and folk music.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- E (Major 3rd)
- G (Perfect 5th)
- A (6th)

## Musical Flavor
The 6th chord in C carries a gentle and harmonious sound, adding a touch of sweetness to musical arrangements. It is often used to evoke feelings of nostalgia, tranquility, and beauty in compositions. The chord's mellow and pleasing quality makes it a popular choice for creating lush and emotive musical landscapes.

## Songs
Here are 3 songs that prominently feature the 6th chord in C:
1. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
2. "Landslide" by Fleetwood Mac
3. "Put Your Records On" by Corinne Bailey Rae

This chord voicing in the key of C is versatile and can be incorporated into various musical styles to enhance melodies and enrich harmonic progressions.
